captions.text: Mayweather: PACQUIAO IS FAMOUS

'CAUSE HE'S CONNECTED
TO MY NAME.

WHEN THEY MENTION PACQUIAO,
THEY SAY, "WHO IS THAT?"

THEY SAY, "THAT'S THE GUY
THAT WE TRYING TO GET
TO FIGHT FLOYD MAYWEATHER."

WHEN THEY SAY
"FLOYD MAYWEATHER,"

THEY SAY,
"THAT'S THE ALL-TIME GREAT."
Narrator: NEAR THE END

OF FLOYD MAYWEATHER'S
HISTORIC CAREER,

THERE REMAINED
ONE EPIC DISCONNECT.

Mayweather: Y'ALL KEEP ASKING
THE SAME QUESTION
OVER AND OVER AGAIN.

THE PACQUIAO-MAYWEATHER FIGHT
IS NOT GONNA HAPPEN.

Narrator: WHAT THE PUBLIC WANTED
FROM HIM...

Man: WHAT YOU SHOULD WORRY ABOUT
IS GETTING IN THERE

AND MAKING THE FIGHT THAT
ALL THE BOXING FANS WANT TO SEE.

Narrator: ...AND WHAT
HE'D PROMISED HIMSELF...

Mayweather: I'M NOT DUCKING
OR DODGING NOBODY. NEVER HAVE.

PEOPLE ALREADY HAVE
THEIR MIND MADE UP.

Narrator: ...NEVER TO BE TREATED
AS A PEER.

Man: IF THERE WAS EVER A FIGHT
IN HISTORY
THAT SHOULD BE SPLIT 50/50,

IT'S THE PACQUIAO-MAYWEATHER
FIGHT.

Narrator:
IN MAYWEATHER'S ESTIMATION,
HE HAS NONE.

Mayweather: ALL PACQUIAO DOING
IS FIGHTING MY LEFTOVERS, MAN.

Narrator:
IT WAS NO LONGER ABOUT BEING
THE BEST FIGHTER IN THE WORLD...

Mayweather:
WHEN I GET UP ON THE PODIUM

AND I SAY,
"YEAH, PACQUIAO, YOU'RE NEXT,"

IF THAT'S WHAT Y'ALL
WANT TO HEAR, THAT'S
WHAT I GOT TO GET Y'ALL

'CAUSE THAT'S WHAT
Y'ALL WANT TO HEAR ANYWAY.

Narrator:
...BUT THE MOST POWERFUL --
EVER.

Announcer:
...CHAMPION OF THE WORLD --
MANNY PACQUIAO!
Narrator: SO WHY PACQUIAO?

Man:
EVERYBODY'S BEEN WAITING FOR IT.

NOW WE GET IT.
Narrator: WHY NOW?

Man: EVERYONE IS TALKING
ABOUT THIS FIGHT.
Narrator: WHAT CHANGED?

Man:
THIS IS THE ONE FIGHT THAT THE
ENTIRE PLANET HAS WANTED TO SEE.
Narrator: NOT FLOYD MAYWEATHER.

Announcer:
...CHAMPION OF THE WORLD --
FLOYD "MONEY" MAYWEATHER!

Narrator: IN THE END,
IT ALL WENT IN HIS FAVOR...

Man: THERE'S BEEN SO MUCH
PENT-UP ANTICIPATION NOW
FOR THE BETTER PART OF A DECADE.

Narrator: ...THE PURSE...
Mayweather:
HOW CAN YOU ASK FOR 50/50

IF YOU'RE NOT DOING
THE SAME NUMBERS THAT I'M DOING?
Narrator: ...THE PROTOCOL...

Man:
HAVING THINGS ON HIS TERMS --

THAT'S HOW MONEY MAYWEATHER
GOES ABOUT THINGS IN BOXING.

Narrator:
...THE PREROGATIVES OF POWER.

Woman: THIS THING,
AS AN ECONOMIC MILESTONE,

IS ALMOST IMPOSSIBLE
TO OVERSTATE.

Narrator:
HE GOT EVERYTHING HE WANTED.

Man:
HE DOMINATED THE NEGOTIATIONS,

AND THAT'S WHY THIS FIGHT
IS HAPPENING.

Narrator: AND NOW HE'S GOT
EVERYTHING TO LOSE.

-- Captions by VITAC --
 www.vitac.com

Man:
WELCOME TO THIS AMAZING MOMENT
IN BOXING AND SPORTS HISTORY.

WE'RE VERY EXCITED
TO BE OFFICIALLY ANNOUNCING

ONE OF THE BIGGEST EVENTS EVER
IN ALL OF SPORTS --

FLOYD MAYWEATHER
VERSUS MANNY PACQUIAO,
SATURDAY, MAY THE 2nd,

AT THE MGM GRAND GARDEN ARENA
IN LAS VEGAS
AND LIVE ON PAY-PER-VIEW.

Narrator:
A TABLEAUX THAT MILLIONS NEVER
THOUGHT THEY'D NEVER SEE --

FLOYD MAYWEATHER
AND MANNY PACQUIAO
SHARING A STAGE TO ANNOUNCE

NOT JUST THE FIGHT
OF THE CENTURY,

BUT THE RICHEST FIGHT
IN HISTORY.

IT'S THEIR ONLY JOINT APPEARANCE
UNTIL FIGHT WEEK,

THE ONLY TIME
THESE TWO WILL MEET
BEFORE ARRIVING IN LAS VEGAS.

Mayweather: I'M IN THE GYM,
WORKING RIGHT NOW,

DEDICATING MYSELF,
PUSHING MYSELF TO THE LIMIT,

BECAUSE I NEVER WANTED TO WIN
A FIGHT SO BAD IN MY LIFE.

IT'S BEEN A LONG ROAD,
BUT WE HERE NOW.
[ APPLAUSE ]
TO ALL THE MEDIA AND PRESS,

THANK YOU SO MUCH
FOR ALL YOUR SUPPORT.
AND TO THE FANS OF BOXING,

I BELIEVE THAT IS WHAT
ARE YOU WAITING FOR
SINCE FIVE YEARS AGO.

Narrator: THE PRESS CONFERENCE
TO END ALL PRESS CONFERENCES

SEEMS A CURIOUSLY
SUBDUED AFFAIR.

PERHAPS AFTER YEARS
OF ACCUSATION,
RECRIMINATION, AND NEGOTIATION,

THE PRINCIPLES ARE FINALLY
TIRED OF TALK.

EVERYBODY SAID,
"HEY, WITH THE ANIMOSITY,

WITH THE CAMPS,
WE'LL NEVER GET THIS DONE."
BUT THAT'S NOT TRUE.
[ LAUGHS ]
YOU MISSED ME, RIGHT, FLOYD?
[ LAUGHTER ]

Narrator: THE HISTORY BETWEEN
MAYWEATHER AND BOB ARUM
IS A LONG ONE,

FRAUGHT WITH SLIGHTS
AND BATTLES,

GRAND DESIGNS
AND THWARTED AMBITIONS.

IT DATES TO 1996, WHEN FLOYD
MADE HIS PROFESSIONAL DEBUT
UNDER ARUM'S PROMOTIONAL BANNER.

Mayweather:
WHEN I WENT TO TOP RANK,
AT THAT PARTICULAR TIME,

THEIR WHOLE FOCUS
WAS OSCAR DE LE HOYA.
THE GOLDEN BOY...
[ CHEERS AND APPLAUSE ]

Mayweather:
HE WAS THE CASH COW.

SO THE ONLY THING I COULD DO
IS RESPECT THAT.

BOB ARUM WANTED ME TO BE
A CERTAIN WAY.

SO THAT'S WHY WE KEPT
BUMPING HEADS,
KEPT BUMPING HEADS.

HE CAME OUT, YOU SHOWBOATED
A LITTLE BIT EARLY.

YOU DO THAT.
THAT'S PART OF YOUR THING.

OBVIOUSLY, IT RANKLED THE CROWD
A LITTLE BIT.

THEY WEREN'T THRILLED
WITH THAT.

SOME GUYS YOU LOVE,
SOME GUYS YOU HATE.
THAT'S WHAT SELLS TICKETS,

AND I'M HERE TO SELL TICKETS,
YOU KNOW?
I'M A PERFORMER.

THAT'S WHAT I DO.
I SELL MYSELF.

Mayweather: I'D RATHER BE HATED
FOR BEING REAL
AND WHO I AM

THAN BE LOVED
FOR SOMEONE THAT I'M NOT.
Narrator: AFTER 10 YEARS,

MAYWEATHER DECIDED
TO ASSUME CONTROL OF HIS CAREER
AND HIS IDENTITY.

HE BOUGHT HIMSELF
OUT OF HIS CONTRACT WITH ARUM.

Mayweather:
FINALLY, WHEN I GOT FREE
AND BECAME MY OWN BOSS,
I DONE THINGS MY WAY.

Narrator: "PRETTY BOY" FLOYD
WAS A THING OF THE PAST.

IN HIS PLACE EMERGED
A LOUDER, MORE BRASH PERSONA,

MONEY MAYWEATHER,
OWNER OF MAYWEATHER PROMOTIONS.

HE'D SO OFFEND
TO MAKE OFFENSE A SKILL.

FLOYD BOOKED A FIGHT
AGAINST NONE OTHER

THAN ARUM'S ERSTWHILE
GOLDEN BOY, OSCAR DE LA HOYA.

Mayweather:
THAT'S WHEN WE STARTED DOING
RECORD-BREAKING NUMBERS,
AND THAT'S WHAT IT'S ABOUT.

Narrator: IT WAS THE BIGGEST
PURSE BOXING HAD EVER SEEN,
WELL OVER $150 MILLION.

FLOYD WON
THE SUPER WELTERWEIGHT BELT

AND THE MYTHICAL
POUND-FOR-POUND TITLE.

WHAT'S MORE,
IT WOULD THE LAST TIME

ANYONE CALLED HIM
THE B-SIDE FIGHTER.

MONEY ISN'T EVERYTHING.
MONEY IS THE ONLY THING.
YOU HEARD THAT.

Narrator: MEANWHILE,
A NEW FIGHTER GAINED TOP BILLING
IN ARUM'S STABLE.

BOXING'S FIRST AND ONLY
EIGHT DIVISION CHAMPION,

MANNY PACQUIAO,
WAS NAMED FIGHTER OF THE DECADE,

STAKING HIS OWN CLAIM
OF THE POUND-FOR-POUND TITLE.

BUT THE FIGHT EVERYONE WANTED
NEVER MATERIALIZED,

AS THE RIVAL CAMPS
COULDN'T COME TO TERMS.

Mayweather: WE TRIED TO MAKE
THIS FIGHT HAPPEN IN THE PAST.

YOU KNOW,
THE TEAMS KEPT BUMPING HEADS

BECAUSE OF RANDOM
BLOOD AND URINE TESTING,

ABOUT BEING THE A-SIDE
AND WHO'S GONNA BE THE B-SIDE.
WE FINALLY RESOLVED EVERYTHING.

THE TEAMS GOT ON THE SAME PAGE,
AND WE MADE THE FIGHT HAPPEN.

Pacquiao:
HE'S THE A-SIDE, AND I'M B-SIDE.
I ACCEPT THAT.

I LIKE BEING THE UNDERDOG,
AND I THINK IT'S BEEN A WHILE.
TO GIVE MORE MOTIVATION,

DETERMINATION TO FOCUS THE FIGHT
AND TO PROVE SOMETHING.

WHAT WAS THE ONE THING FOR YOU
THAT YOU SAID, "LET'S DO THIS"?

WELL, EVERYONE
WANTS TO KEEP TALKING

ABOUT HOW THIS FIGHT
HAPPENED.

THIS FIGHT HAPPENED
BECAUSE OF ME.

♪ I JUST WANT THE GREEN,
I JUST WANT THE GREEN ♪
♪ I JUST WANT THE GREEN ♪

I GOT TO GO SHOOT
MY COMMERCIAL.

♪ I JUST WANT THE GREEN,
I JUST WANT THE GREEN ♪
♪ THIS FOR THE MONEY-MAKERS ♪

SEE, I LOOK NICE IN MY SUIT,
BUT WHEN I COME OUT OF MY SUIT,

THEY SAY
I'M GONNA STRAIGHT KILL IT.

[ LAUGHS ]
YOU'RE RIGHT ABOUT THAT.

THIS IS JUSTIN AND BRIAN.
WHAT'S UP? JUSTIN.

WHAT'S UP, BABY?
WHAT'S UP?

THOSE VERY TALENTED
INDIVIDUALS,

THEY'RE GONNA BE
DIRECTING YOU TODAY

OKAY, SO THAT'S FLOYD
AND THAT'S PAC.

OKAY, I SEE!
I SEE IT, I SEE IT!
[ LAUGHTER ]

HE GONNA BE ALL NIGHT.
YOU KNOW ME.

I'M GONNA GET MINE DONE
[SNAPS] 1, 2, 3.
[ SPEAKS INDISTINCTLY ]
BUT HE GONNA BE ALL NIGHT.

YOU REALIZE
IT'S THE BIG DANCE NOW?
...I ALREADY BEEN HERE.

YOU KNOW,
I ALREADY BEEN HERE BEFORE.

ALL I'M DOING
IS BREAKING MY OWN RECORDS.

AIN'T LIKE I BREAKING
NOBODY ELSE'S RECORDS.

AIN'T NOTHING
BUT BREAKING MY OWN.

ALL RIGHT, GUYS.
HERE WE GO.

QUIET ON THE SET!
ROLL SOUND, PLEASE.

ROLLING.
ROLL CAMERA.

Narrator: AFTER ALL THESE YEARS,
HE KNOWS THE DRILL.
A ROUTINE PROMO SHOOT.

STILL, THERE'S NOTHING ROUTINE
IN THE BUILDUP TO THIS FIGHT.

EVEN FOUR-TIME
SUPER BOWL CHAMPION TOM BRADY'S
CAUGHT UP IN THE HYPE.

HE'S COMING TO THE FIGHT.
HE'S COMING TO THE FIGHT.

BRADY, MY GOD.
YOU KNOW, THE ONE AND ONLY.

BRADY: I can't miss this, man.
I can't miss this, man.
[ LAUGHS ]

WE'RE AT THE COMMERCIAL SHOOT
RIGHT NOW.

Good, man.
Well, good luck to you.

I know you're gonna --
YOU KNOW,
I APPRECIATE IT, MAN.

ALL RIGHT, BRADY.
MY GUY.

All right, man.
All right.

MAYWEATHER VERSUS PACQUIAO --
ORDER NOW.

PERFECT.
GREAT JOB.
CUT THERE, GUYS.

THAT'S A GOOD NIGHT
TO MR. MAYWEATHER.
THANK YOU VERY MUCH, SIR.
[ CHEERS AND APPLAUSE ]

I DONE
A HELL OF A JOB.
THANK YOU, CHAMP.

I DONE
A HELL OF A JOB.

AND THAT BOY GONNA BE ALL DAY
ON THAT TELEPROMPTER.
[ LAUGHS ]

I DO THAT THING
SO QUICK.

I'M QUICK
WITH THAT TELEPROMPTER, BOY.

I'M QUICK
WITH THAT THING.

♪ EVER SINCE I WAS A YOUNGIN',
THE ONLY THING I KNOW ♪

♪ EVEN THOUGH YOU GOT RICH,
YOU CAN ALWAYS GET MORE ♪

♪ 'CAUSE IT'S ALL ABOUT
THE MONEY, MONEY, MONEY ♪

♪ ALL ABOUT
THE MONEY, MONEY, MONEY ♪

♪ I DO THIS FOR MY HUSTLERS
THAT HUSTLE ALL DAY ♪

♪ MY STRUGGLERS THAT KNOW
ALL THEY CUSTOMERS' FULL NAMES ♪

♪ 'CAUSE IT'S ALL ABOUT
THE MONEY, MONEY, MONEY ♪

♪ ALL ABOUT
THE MONEY, MONEY, MONEY ♪

Narrator: WITH NO PRESS TOUR
FOR THIS FIGHT,

FLOYD IMMEDIATELY RETURNS
TO HIS LAS VEGAS GYM
AND GETS BACK TO WORK.

Man:
MASTER OF THE HURT BUSINESS.

WE'RE WATCHING A LEGEND
RIGHT NOW.
A LEGEND AT WORK.

THE INTEREST
IN MAYWEATHER'S MUSINGS
HAVE REACHED AN ALL-TIME HIGH.
CAMERAS ARE EVERYWHERE.

BUT AS THEIR FOCUS NARROWS
ON HIM,

SO DOES FLOYD'S FOCUS NARROW
ON HIS TRAINING.

A FIGHTER DOESN'T BECOME
47-0 ALL ALONE.

IF THE FIGHT ITSELF
IS A SOLITARY ENDEAVOR,
THE TRAINING IS NOT.

JUST AS MAYWEATHER EVOLVED,
SO HAS HIS CAMP.

Mayweather:
I DIDN'T DO IT BY MYSELF.

YOU KNOW, EVERYBODY PLAYED
A MAJOR, MAJOR ROLE,
FROM MY FATHER TO ROGER.
THE LIST GOES ON AND ON.

BUT I DIDN'T GET TO
WHERE I GOT TO OVERNIGHT.

IT TOOK TIME.
IT TOOK A LOT OF TIME.
EACH AND EVERY DAY,

MY TEAM GET STRONGER
AND STRONGER AND STRONGER.

THAT'S WHAT I NEED TO PREPARE ME
FOR A FIGHT OF THIS MAGNITUDE.

Man: GOOD WORK, GOOD WORK,
GOOD WORK, GOOD WORK, GOOD WORK.

ALL RIGHT, LET'S HOLD!
COME ON!

HARD WORK!
Men: DEDICATION!

HARD WORK!
DEDICATION!

HARD WORK!
DEDICATION!

AND JUST LIKE A FIGHT,
YOU SWITCH UP PACES.

SOMETIMES YOU FIGHT HARD.
SOMETIMES YOU FIGHT RELAXED.

BUT YOU ALWAYS CONTROL
THE PACE.

AND IF YOU'RE REGULAR,
YOU JUST SLIDE LIGHT,
YOU SHOOT A SPEAR JAB.
THAT'S WHAT IT'S CALLED.

BUT A SOUTHPAW,
YOU GOT TO SLIDE HEAVY OVER.

TO GET HIM OVER THERE,
TO GET HIM OUT OF POSITION.

I'M TALKING ABOUT LIKE
OVER HERE. BOOM.
THAT'S THE KEY.

THAT'S THAT HOT...
TO STOP THAT BOY.
THAT'S THAT HOT...

THAT HAS HIM THROWING IN
THE WHITE FLAG.

Narrator:
FLOYD'S COTERIE OF ACOLYTES

INCLUDES TRUSTED FRIENDS,
FAMILY, AND STRATEGISTS.
SOME OF THEM RECENT ADDITIONS.

OTHERS HAVE BEEN HERE
FOR YEARS.

BUT ONE CRUCIAL FIGURE
HAS BEEN IN AND OUT
ACROSS THE DECADES -- FLOYD SR,
THE CHAMP'S FIRST TRAINER.

FLOYD WAS RAISED IN THE GYMS
OF GRAND RAPIDS, MICHIGAN.
TRY IT AGAIN.

A YOUTH SPENT STUDYING
THOSE WHO CAME BEFORE HIM,

HIS FATHER AND HIS UNCLE ROGER,
BOTH WELL-REGARDED PROS.

Man: PUT YOUR HANDS DOWN
AS YOU DO IT.
STILL, IT WAS CLEAR EARLY ON

HIS TALENT SURPASSED
EVEN HIS PEDIGREE.

IN 1993,
UNDER HIS FATHER'S TUTELAGE,

FLOYD WON HIS FIRST NATIONAL
GOLDEN GLOVES CHAMPIONSHIP.
HE WAS 16.

Mayweather: IT FEELS GOOD,
BUT IT WAS VERY HARD.

I HAD TO STRUGGLE, YOU KNOW,
STRUGGLE TO FIGHT.

BUT FIRST, I WANT TO THANK
THE GOOD MAN UPSTAIRS
FOR GIVING ME THIS OPPORTUNITY

TO WIN THE NATIONAL
CHAMPIONSHIP.

AND SECOND OF ALL,
I WANT TO THANK MY FATHER.

HE'S THE BEST IN THE MIDWEST,
I MUST CONFESS.

ALL THE REST
IS NO CONTEST.

WHEN HE WAS YOUNG, MAN,
YOU COULD --

YOU CAN'T BELIEVE
WHAT HE WAS DOING.

I MEAN, THIS GUY WAS DESTINED
TO BE A CHAMPION.

AND I DID WHAT IT TOOK
TO GET HIM WHERE HE HAD TO GO.
AND, YOU KNOW,

AND IN THE PROCESS OF ME
DOING ALL THAT,
I END UP GOING TO PRISON.
Narrator: JUST WEEKS REMOVED

FROM FLOYD'S FIRST
NATIONAL TITLE,

SENIOR WAS SENTENCED TO 5h YEARS
FOR DRUG TRAFFICKING.

Mayweather Sr.: THAT WAS
A BAD, HARD THING FOR ME.

I THOUGHT ABOUT MY SON
A WHOLE LOT.

WE USED TO TALK A LOT
ON THE TELEPHONE, YOU KNOW,
AND HE USED TO ASK ME THINGS,

AND TELL HIM THINGS
ABOUT WHAT HE NEED TO DO,
AND I DID THAT.

Narrator:
YOUNG MEN NEED THEIR FATHERS.
FIGHTERS NEED THEIR TRAINERS.
FLOYD HAD LOST BOTH.

AND WHILE SOME PREDICTED
THE END OF HIS AMATEUR CAREER,

HE WENT ON TO WIN TWO MORE
NATIONAL GOLDEN GLOVES TITLES.

AT 19,
WITH HIS DAD STILL IN PRISON,

HE QUALIFIED
FOR THE '96 OLYMPIC GAMES
IN ATLANTA.

Mayweather: I THINK ABOUT HIM.
I THINK ABOUT HIM.
HE IN MY HEART.

I'LL GO DOWN THERE
THINKING HE IN MY CORNER.

JUST DON'T THINK
ABOUT NOTHING ELSE.

I'LL GO DOWN THERE
THINKING HE IN MY CORNER.

EVERYTHING IN LIFE HAPPENS
FOR A REASON,

AND THAT MADE ME WORK HARD
AND PUSH MYSELF TO THE LIMIT.

Narrator: IN ADVANCING
TO THE QUARTERFINALS,

FLOYD BECAME THE FIRST
AMERICAN OLYMPIAN

TO BEAT A CUBAN FIGHTER
IN 20 YEARS.

AND THOUGH HIS FATHER REMAINED
IN FEDERAL PENITENTIARY
700 MILES AWAY,
HE WAS DETERMINED TO ENJOY IT.

HEY THEY GOT A PIN-TRADING PLACE
OVER HERE.
I'M GONNA TRADE MY PIN.

HEY, WHAT PIN --
Y'ALL HAVE THIS PIN?

SO, WHAT YOU GONNA TRADE ME
FOR THIS FOR?

THEY AIN'T REALLY INTO
THIS PIN TRADING.

Narrator:
AMONG FLOYD'S TEAMMATES
WAS HEAVYWEIGHT NATE JONES,

WHO WENT ON TO WIN BRONZE
FOR AMERICAN THAT SUMMER.

WE BOTH MADE THE OLYMPIC TEAM
IN 1996.

IT WAS THE GREATEST MOMENT
OF OUR LIVES.

I WAS IN THE SEMIFINALS,
AS WELL.
MY FIGHT WAS BEFORE HIS.
I LOST A VERY CLOSE DECISION.
I WAS VERY DISAPPOINTED,

BUT NOW IT WAS TIME FOR ME
TO SUPPORT MY TEAMMATE.

Announcer:
OH, A RIGHT HAND BY MAYWEATHER.

AND HE FOLLOWED UP
WITH THE RIGHT.
FLOYD DOMINATED THE FIGHT.

THAT'S WHERE MAYWEATHER
WANTS TO BE,

ON THE INSIDE,
WORKING THE BODY AND THE HEAD.
HE CLEARLY GOT ROBBED.

I MEAN,
IT WAS THE WORST DECISION
I'VE SEEN IN THE WHOLE OLYMPICS.

Announcer: THE WINNER,
FROM THE RED CORNER...

Announcer#2:
CANNOT BE SERIOUS.

SO, THE WINNER
IS SERAFIM TODOROV.

ALTHOUGH THE REFEREE,
SHULMAN, RAISED THE HAND
OF FLOYD MAYWEATHER.

GUESS WHAT?
THIS WAS NOT A GOOD DECISION.

Man: FLOYD TOOK IT LIKE A CHAMP,
BUT NOT U.S.A. BOXING.

Mitchell: THEY NEED TO GET RID
OF THE WHOLE SYSTEM

AND GET A NEW ESTABLISHMENT
TO CONTROL AMATEUR BOXING.

WELL, YOU KNOW,
I THINK THAT, YOU KNOW,

I DON'T REALLY WANT TO SAY
I WON A BRONZE MEDAL.

I THINK IT'S BEST TO SAY
I RECEIVED A BRONZE MEDAL,

BECAUSE YOU CAN'T WIN A BRONZE
IF YOU LOST.

Waeckerle: I WAS THERE.
HOW UNFORTUNATE.
THAT SHOULD HAVE NEVER HAPPENED.

MAY 2nd,
HE SHOULD HAVE A GOLD MEDAL

HANGING IN HIS CORNER,
BUT HE DIDN'T GET HER, DID HE?

SOMEONE TOOK THAT FROM HIM,
AND THAT'S WHY I RESIGNED.

Narrator:
BILL WAECKERLE SPENT 15 YEARS

WORKING WITH THE INTERNATIONAL
BOXING ASSOCIATION.

HE WITNESSED MANY QUESTIONABLE
AND CONTROVERSIAL DECISIONS,

BUT NONE WORSE THAN WHAT HE SAW
THAT NIGHT IN ATLANTA.

WAECKERLE RESIGNED IMMEDIATELY
AFTER MAYWEATHER'S LOSS

AND RETIRED
TO HIS NATIVE SOUTH DAKOTA.
Waeckerle: WELL, NOW YOU KNOW

WHERE OLD, WORN-OUT
BOXING REFEREES END UP, HUH?
[ LAUGHS ]
IN 1996 OLYMPIC GAMES,

MY POSITION
WAS THE SENIOR REFEREE JUDGE
FOR THE UNITED STATES.

I MONITORED THE JUDGING
AND THE REFEREEING,

KEPT AN EYE ON
WHAT WAS GOING ON,

HOW THE DECISIONS WERE GOING,
HOW THE REFEREES WERE WORKING.

Man: I GUESS I JUST THOUGHT
YOU ALWAYS REFEREED.
Waeckerle: WE DO BOTH.
IS THERE A DIFFERENCE?

YEAH, YOU'RE IN THE RING
WHEN YOU'RE REFEREEING,

AND YOU'RE SITTING AT THE TABLE
WHEN YOU'RE JUDGING.
OH.

YOUR EXPOSURE
IS SEVERELY LIMITED

WHEN YOU'RE IN
THE JUDGING SEAT,

EXCEPT FOR CONTROVERSIAL
DECISIONS.
[ LAUGHS ]

Waeckerle: IF YOU LOOK
AT THE FINAL SCORE --

IF ANYBODY WITH ONE EYE
AND 90 YEARS OLD

CAN TELL ME
THAT FLOYD MAYWEATHER

DIDN'T SCORE AT LEAST 40 BLOWS
IN THOSE THREE ROUNDS...

FLOYD MAYWEATHER WON THAT BOUT.
HE WON EVERY ROUND.

AND I SAID,
"WITH ALL DUE RESPECT,

I WILL NOT BE INVOLVED
IN AN ORGANIZATION
THAT CHEATS YOUNG MEN

OUT OF THEIR RIGHT
TO HAVE A GOLD MEDAL.
AND THERE'S MY RESIGNATION."

Mayweather:
WE ALL KNOW I GOT RIPPED OFF,

YOU KNOW,
I GOT TO LIVE WITH IT, YOU KNOW.

I'M JUST GONNA, YOU KNOW,
TAKE MY BRONZE MEDAL, YOU KNOW,
AND GO HOME, YOU KNOW.

IT'S TIME FOR ME TO TURN
PROFESSIONAL, YOU KNOW.

I CAN'T DEAL WITH
THIS AMATEUR BOXING ANYMORE.

Narrator:
IT'S DIFFICULT TO ARGUE
WITH FLOYD'S CAREER CHOICES.

WHERE OTHERS MAY HAVE DWELT
ON THE INJUSTICE,
MAYWEATHER FOUND INCENTIVE.

Mayweather:
THE '96 OLYMPIC GAMES,

I'M HAPPY WITH HOW
THE RESULTS WENT.

I'M REALLY HAPPY,
BECAUSE THAT MADE ME STRIVE

AND WORK HARD
TO GET TO WHERE I'M AT TODAY.

Narrator: THE BEST THING
THAT CAN COME FROM A LOSS
IS TO NEVER LOSE AGAIN,

WHICH IS WHY FLOYD CONTINUES
HIS RELENTLESS PACE IN THE GYM.

NO VIDEO, NO PICTURE!
ALL PHONES, CAMERAS AWAY!

Man:
OR YOU WILL BE ASKED TO LEAVE!

FOR THIS FIGHT,
THE USE OF CELLPHONES

HAS BEEN PROHIBITED INSIDE
THE MAYWEATHER BOXING CLUB,

ALLOWING ONLY PROFESSIONAL
MEDIA OUTLETS TO FILM.

THERE WILL BE NO DISTRACTIONS
AND NO EXCEPTIONS.

UNLESS, PERHAPS,
YOU'RE A MEDIA ICON.

Couric: I'VE NEVER EXPERIENCED
ANYTHING LIKE THIS.
IT'S PRETTY REMARKABLE

TO SEE JUST HOW DISCIPLINED
AND FOCUSED HE IS.

I MEAN,
IT'S JUST SO FUN TO WATCH HIM.

I THOUGHT ABOUT
TRYING TO GET A TICKET

[Laughing] UNTIL I HEARD
THEY WERE LIKE $87,000.

THAT'S LIKE
IN THE SIXTH ROW, THOUGH.
REALLY?

RINGSIDE, I'VE GOTTEN ANYWHERE
FROM ABOUT $150,000 GOING UP.
REALLY? WOW.
THAT'S INSANE.
[ CHEERS AND APPLAUSE ]

GOT THAT CHANEL WATCH ON,
HUH?

THE FIRST THING HE SAID TO ME
WAS, "NICE CHANEL WATCH."
THIS GUY KNOWS HIS WATCHES.
WHO BOUGHT YOU THAT?
I BOUGHT IT FOR MYSELF.
OKAY, THAT'S A NICE WATCH.
[ LAUGHS ]

ALL THEM YEARS
OF HARD WORK.
YEAH, EXACTLY.
I DON'T KNOW NEED ANYBODY

TO BUY MY WATCHES,
MR. MAYWEATHER.

HEY, WHEN DO I DO
MY INTERVIEW?
IS SHE READY NOW?

40 MINUTES TO...SET UP?
IS YOU...CRAZY?

Narrator: FLOYD VIEWS MEDIA
OBLIGATIONS AS A NECESSARY EVIL.

BUT AN AUDIENCE
WITH KATIE COURIC
ISN'T AN OBLIGATION

SO MUCH AS AN OPPORTUNITY
TO EXPAND HIS BRAND.

Couric: YOU KNOW, I THINK HE HAS
GOT SUCH AN INTERESTING PERSONA.

I WONDER HOW MUCH OF IT
IS SORT OF REQUIRED.

AND HOW MUCH
IS IT REALLY YOU?
I'M JUST CURIOUS.

TO MAKE
THIS TYPE OF MONEY,

SOMEONE HAS TO KNOW
WHO FLOYD MAYWEATHER IS.

I'M SURE THIS WILL COME
AS A SHOCK TO YOU,

BUT I DON'T KNOW A TON
ABOUT BOXING.

LET'S TALK ABOUT
MANNY PACQUIAO.
WHAT KIND OF FIGHTER --

HOW WOULD YOU DESCRIBE HIM
AS A FIGHTER?
UM...
STRONG LEFT JAB, RIGHT?
WELL, I HAVE A STRONG LEFT.

HE'S A SOUTHPAW,
SO HE GOT A STRONG RIGHT JAB.

OH, SORRY.
IT'S OKAY.
CUT.

I'M NOT AN EXPERT
IN WHAT HE DOES.

I WANT TO TRANSLATE IT
TO THE AVERAGE PERSON.

DO YOU EVER JUST EAT
A GALLON OF HAAGEN-DAZS
AND SAY, "SCREW IT"?

YOU'RE GONNA MAKE
$180 MILLION IN THIS FIGHT
NO MATTER WHAT HAPPENS?
[ LAUGHS ]

OH, MY GOD.
YES.
IS THAT INSANE?
NO, IT'S NOT INSANE.

TO SEE EVERYTHING THAT GOES
INTO A FIGHT LIKE THIS,
IT DOES MAKE YOU APPRECIATE

THE PURE PHYSICALITY
OF THE SPORT.

WE'RE NOT EVEN
FINISHED WORKING.

WE STILL GOT ANOTHER WORKOUT
LATER ON TONIGHT.
WHAT ARE YOU GONNA DO?
PROBABLY CHOP TREES.
CHOP TREES?
YES.
THROWBACK WORKOUT.
[ GRUNTING ]

Narrator: PERHAPS THIS ISN'T
THE HEAVY LIFTING

FLOYD'S SECURITY DETAIL
HAD IN MIND TODAY,
BUT IT'S WHAT THE BOSS WANTS.

WOOD-CHOPPING IS PART OF
AN OLD-SCHOOL FIGHTER'S REGIMEN,

ONE THAT, IN THE PAST,
FLOYD HAS OFTEN UTILIZED.

AT THE END OF IT,
IT'S GONNA BE WHERE HE WANTS IT.
READY? 2, 3.

[ GRUNTS ]
STOP, STOP, STOP, STOP.
DAMN.

Mayweather:
IT ALL STARTED IN 1987

WITH ME USING A SLEDGEHAMMER,
HITTING A TIRE.

AS I GOT OLDER, I GRADUALLY
MOVED TO CHOPPING WOOD.
THAT'S THE BASICS,

GOING BACK
TO WHERE IT ALL STARTED FROM.

Narrator: IT'S BEEN YEARS
SINCE HE LAST DID THIS.
BUT IT FEELS RIGHT NOW,
ON THE EVE OF HIS BIGGEST FIGHT,

FINDING COMFORT
IN A FAMILIAR RHYTHM.

Woman:
IT'S THE FIGHT OF THE CENTURY.

WHAT DO YOU THINK
IT'S GONNA TAKE TO BEAT HIM?

Man:
DOES PACQUIAO HAVE ANY CHANCE?

CAN YOU AGREE THAT THIS FIGHT
IS NOT JUST ANOTHER FIGHT?

Man: VERY IMPORTANT
FOR YOUR LEGACY, ISN'T IT?

FLOYD, TELL ME, WILL THIS FIGHT
MAKE HISTORY, AND WHY?

A FIGHT SO BIG,
IT DOESN'T HAVE TO BE SOLD.

Mayweather:
THERE'S NO PRESSURE AT ALL.

EVERYTHING HAPPENS FOR A REASON,
AND I WAS BORN FOR THIS MOMENT.
[ INDISTINCT SHOUTING ]
Narrator: IN FACT,

THOUGH FLOYD'S BEEN SELLING IT
ALL HIS LIFE...
Mayweather: I'M A PERFORMER.

THAT'S WHAT I DO.
I SELL MYSELF.

...EVEN AS HE SHED ONE PERSONA
FOR ANOTHER,

EVEN AS HE BECAME
MONEY MAYWEATHER.

WAIT TILL WE GET
UNDER THE...LIGHTS
AND IT'S LIGHTS, CAMERA, ACTION.

SOME PEOPLE LOOK AT IT
AS BEING AN...

SOME PEOPLE LOOK AT IT
AS BEING COCKY.

IT WAS JUST A SMART
BUSINESS MOVE

BY A YOUNG KID
FROM GRAND RAPIDS.

Narrator: THE MOST LUCRATIVE ACT
IN THE HISTORY OF SPORTS

HAS FINALLY REACHED
ITS DESTINATION,
THE APOTHEOSIS OF A CAREER.

Mayweather:
I WORKED MY WHOLE LIFE
TO GET TO THIS POINT.

I WAS DESTINED TO BE
WHERE I'M AT.

MY LIFE'S SUPPOSED TO PLAY OUT
LIKE THIS.

Narrator: THE FIGHT
OF THE CENTURY WAS BORN
WITH THE ROLE OF A LIFETIME.

NEVER CRY, NEVER COMPLAIN,
JUST WORK.
Man: THAT'S RIGHT.
NOW COMES THE TEST...
...OF HIS LIFE'S WORK.

DON'T MISS
MAYWEATHER VERSUS PACQUIAO,

SATURDAY, MAY 2nd,
LIVE ON PAY-PER-VIEW.

comments.text:
Anyone eho thought that Pacman at this stage of his career could beat 
Mayweather didn't do their homework on this guy. Pacman 5 or 6 years ago 
would have been a bigger problem, but people have this idea of Pacman still 
being this superb ko artist because they believed the media hype. Pacman 
going in had not ko'd anyone for 6 yrs. If Floyd could handle the much 
bigger Maidana who was still koing people then what threat is Pacman at 
this point of his career? People can bitch and whine all they want, but 
this is boxing where it is about hitting and not getting hit and Floyd is 
the best because he understands the game this is not some street brawl. 
Floyd's style beats Manny's style 9 times out of 10 in boxing.﻿

comments.author: Paul Trought

comments.text:
Manny Pacquiao didn't win the fight but I can see why he thought he did. 
He's thinking "He never hurt me. He  never had me in trouble. He never 
shaken me. He never had me down. He never cut me. I was forcing the fight. 
He kept trying to tie me up on the inside" all that is true, but that is 
also true of the majority of Mayweathers fights over the past 10 years.

They all could say that.

It's not what Mayweather does to you, it's what Mayweather does not allow 
you to do to him, that wins him fights. He does not allow his opponents to 
hurt him much, nail him clean, gain momentum, he snuffs his opponent out. 
Thus because he does that. Mayweather does not have to do much in terms of 
being offensive to win fights. He does not have to beat the fighter down. 
He does not have to win rounds heavy. He does not have to get involved in 
furious exchanges. Sure you can get fighters who can be elusive but 
Mayweather's genius is that he can do that and still do enough to win his 
fights.

AND THAT'S A SERIOUS SKILL IN ITSELF

Mayweather wasn't running from Pac-Man. Stats show he threw more punches 
and never once did Kenny Bayliss (The Ref) caution Mayweather for not 
fighting. Having said. I do think father time is catching up on Floyd. In 
his younger days he was a lot more aggressive and on the front foot and 
threw combos back in the day, when you watch Mayweather against Gatti and 
Corrales you see he;s a totally different fighter now, than he was then, 
but then again weren't all boxer more aggressive and gung ho in their 
younger days ?

Fact is Mayweather is an undefeated multi millionaire who wont be suffering 
from a slurred speech later in life or Parkinsons. He's a smart guy, inside 
and outside the ring. He answers to no-one. He has no promoter as he has 
Mayweather Promotions because he bought out Arum early in his career, 
because Arum was up De La Hoya's a.s.s at that time.

Is Mayweather exciting ? No.

Is he TBE ? Defensively - Yes. Offensively - No.﻿

tie but 8-12 I had Mayweather by a bit. Very boring fight. Pacquiao is 
still much more exciting, knowing the fact that he is smaller and 5" less 
of arm reach. I thought Floyd could have run pac down with his arm reach 
advantage but he just stayed with his old style. I don't care I won money

scorecards, Floyd would still get the win. Man I love boxing. ﻿

originally said no to random drug testing, then offered 40 million..Manny 
said no.  All the time being falsely criticized for fighting JMM..when JMM

comments.author: T Healey

comments.text:
Boxing mirror's fighting but in a sporty fashion. Funny how Floyd's fans 
are suddenly talking 'Non-violence'. That Floyd shouldn't take risks & he 
shouldn't stand there and trade punches, you know the things that make 
boxing exciting and made Mike Tyson & Evander Holyfield legends. Bottom 
line, Floyd Mayweather put a nail on the coffin of Boxing. And his fans 
look stupidly ridiculous trying to justify his scare tactics, while at the 
same time calling him a 'great fighter'. 100 million for RUNNING,HUGGING & 
PUSHING MANNY AWAY..... THE THINGS THAT MADE FLOYD A "LEGEND"﻿
comments.author: EJ Prez

comments.text:
Boxing is pussified nowadays. If you call Floyd the best ever then boxing 
is really screwed. Imagine two Floyd Mayweathers facing each other in the 
ring, sounds exciting? Rest assured you'll be snoring by Round 4. And 
yet... many 'experts' call it BRILLIANCE. Bring on MMA, the new real deal!﻿
comments.author: Supa Maori Bro

comments.text:
+Supa Maori Bro  It's all a matter of taste. I find MMA boring as hell but 
I'm not going to say that others shouldn't watch it. If you don't enjoy 
boxing, watch something else.
